reviews.review_text: Literally made my boyfriend's blackheads disappear! I wasn't so lucky but his were really bad. Made our faces feel so clean. I'm a mask junkie and have gotten masks from all the top brands both drugstore, lush, and sephora or ulta. This is one of my new favorites! Also so much fun to watch it buddy's up, feels like a spa treaatment.

reviews.review_header: It foams up so quickly both on your face and in the jar that i found my fingers did a better job. Its very thick and gooey
reviews.review_text: Regardless of what I am about to say, this is worth the money purely for the novelty of it. I mean, it turns you into a bubble monster, and you cant help but giggle. Very cute packaging. Inside is a little spatula to help put the product on your face. It foams up so quickly both on your face and in the jar that i found my fingers did a better job. Its very thick and gooey, almost like partially dried glue. no noticeable smell, bad or good. I found instructions online that said put it on an uncleaned and dry face, leave it on for 5 minutes then wash it off. I left it on for much longer to see how much it would bubble. It bubbled for the full 10 minutes before I couldn't handle the tickling feeling anymore, and it started to block the air getting to my nose (so in the future, I wouldn't put this on my "mustache" area). This mask did not irritate my skin, but what did irritate my skin is taking it off. Remember how I said it is very thick? Yea. So it took several minutes of washing off with a textured towel. it bubbled up (soap like bubbles, not carbonated bubbles) as i was washing it off, which combined with the instructions saying to put it on an unwashed face, point this more in the direction of a cleanser. Because of its cleansing properties, I would call this more of a cleanser than a mask, but either way, it worked. Assuming that i got all the thick goo off of my face, I would call this a pretty good cleanser (though i didn't try it over makeup, to see if that would come off). it did clear out some of my finer pores. I felt that it was kind of drying, so i followed up immediately with a heavy duty night time moisturizer. Tips: for easier removal and application, go with a thin layer all over your face. But, for first time users, go for a nice thick layer for maximum bubbles! 4 stars because it literally has the texture of glue, and i am not a fan of jar-style products, due to air exposure, bacteria, and higher likelihood of drying out before you finish using the product. Sadly, this is far too thick to even think about putting it into a dispenser. But, this does not kill the joy!

This stuff is awesome! I have only used it once so far but my face already looks and feels cleaner. Obviously didn't get every single blackhead out but I'm sure over time it will. I'll update after using it a few times!

I love this mask. I have combination skin, oily in spots and dry in others. To use it correctly put a thin even layer on quickly. I prefer to use my fingers because the scooper it comes with is kind of awkward. It starts to bubble quickly. Leave it on for 10 minutes and then rub it around your face. The slightly irritating part of this is taking it off. After a few uses I have found using a wet warm washcloth to remove the majority of it works the best (it doesn’t stain at all) and then rinse any remaining residue off with water. I say this because it is a very thick product and kind of slippery I guess would be the word, so its kind of difficult to get off with wet slippery hands. Another word of caution it is carbonated. I know it says it on the bottle but I just didnt really think about it and was pretty surprised by the reaction on my face. Tiny little bubbles popping and can get sort of irritating, and sometimes you REALLY want to rub your face. It is not unbearable and worth it. This stuff works miracles on my black heads, and my skin feels awesome. I will say that I definitely feel like I need to moisturize afterwards but you should anyway. Sometimes I uses a moisturizer sheet mask after and with the two combined my face feels amazing. Also, it’s fun!
SO MANY BUBBLES. SO MUCH JOY!

This is a great mask if you just plan to freshen up. I do not recommend this is any deep pore cleansing. The mask starts bubbling in seconds but don't worry about try to be fast, it will continue to work. Even though the instructions state to put it on a dirty face, I would recommend a cleansing before hand because like i stated this doesn't get into pores very well. I have big pores and intentionally made my face very dirty. On a part of my cheek I put the mask without cleansing, on another part I cleaned first, then put the mask on. After the routine of the mask I rinsed it off and my face was noticeably smoother on the side I cleaned FIRST. This is a unique product but I've definitely used better masks.

Super bubbly! I loved it!! I put it on too thick the first time, and it burned, but the second time I put it on as thin as possible, no burning and more bubbles (see picture). So fun and skin feels great after!

This is my favorite mask ever! I am impatient and can't usually wait for other masks that take 20 minutes to dry (and I hate the drying, pulling feeling). I put this on (using the spatula, very important---do not stick your fingers in the jar!) while my shower is warming up and it starts bubbling immediately! I hop in the shower, and I even use my clarisonic to really work it in, and it bubbles again! Like getting two uses out of one mask! It's easy to rinse off and leaves skin feeling extremely clean. My face is super smooth for at least two days after using it. I have large pores with lots of black heads and sebum (attractive IKR?) and this definitely reduces the amount of visible black heads and I feel less oily. Great product! Great price!

I got this as a gift and finally used it..... laaaaawdddd I don’t know what is in it, but my skin got buuuurned. Note: I did this with my husband and he DID NOT get burned... so it’s probably just me. I must be allergic to something in it because this hurts lol... I must say, it was really fun to see/feel I start bubbling up though. I’ll attach a picture of the carnage I was left with haha - this is no filter, directly under the lamp. Again, husband wasn’t affected like this.

I was so excited for this item! I read the reviews, saw that some people had problems with it before, but went ahead and bought it hoping for the best since there was so many people who made amazing reviews! I got it, and put it on, waited the amount of time it said on box, and looked in the mirror and was disappointed to see that it hadn't foamed up. I looked at the container and noticed the plastic was covered with goo and so was the container. I'm not one who has money to waste and rarely treat myself. I don't usually leave bad reviews or even had problems with Amazon in the past, but if you wanna take your chance, go for it. But I do NOT recommend.

Super fun mask to use! It smells good and makes your skin feel smooth. If you have dry skin you won't love this because it definitely dries your skin out but if you have oily skin you will love it! The 2 cons for me personally would be that it tingles for sure and it's difficult to wash off... unless I'm somehow doing something wrong...

reviews.review_header: When i got the item the box looked fine, but when I opened it there seemed to ...
reviews.review_text: This item is not returnable. Just a heads up. When i got the item the box looked fine, but when I opened it there seemed to be product inside the wrapping. I opened it up and there was tried product on the lip of the bar. Trying not to judge I tested it out on my hand and it foamed up a little. On my face it foamed up fine but it left my face a little dry but it does feel tight. It has a bit of a smell but the expiration date printed says it is fine. Make sure you guys are sure you want this otherwise a regular biore mask from Target is ok too.

reviews.review_header: It's more than a over-hyped trend.
reviews.review_text: I've seen videos on Facebook/YouTube about the carbonated bubble clay masks, and it definitely intrigued me. But, I didn't feel compelled to buy it until I saw an Amazon deal where this was on sale for a low price. I didn't know what to expect from using this, other than it was going to puff up and look like it was eating my face. I was pleasantly surprised by the borderline tingling sensation on my skin, as the mask reacted with the oils in my skin and bubbled up. I did want to see what would happen if I left the mask on longer than the 3-5 minutes on the directions, and went for 10 minutes; it did bubble up a little more, but it wasn't considerably different from the 5 minutes. I would recommend leaving a half-inch to an inch of space beneath your eyes; it did bubble up enough to touch my lower lashes and when I blinked it got onto my top lashes. Also be aware of the product around your nose, that will also bubble up, and you don't want the risk of it going up your nose! So, don't put the clay on your upper lip (I didn't, because breathing is important!). Afterwards, I don't think I've perfected the process of washing this mask off my face, because it does take a considerable amount of time (and water), but I love how my skin feels.

This mask is an infuriating spiritual experience. Please allow me to elaborate: Imagine you're Sisyphus and you're pushing your boulder up the mountain AGAIN. You can (according to Camus) say, "What the heck, might as well be cheerful about it!" and push with a smile on your face. Or, you could say, "No! No more boulder pushing!" and succumb to your grim fate. I've dealt with blackheads forever. FOREVER. Blackheads are my boulder. Some cures are expensive, or time-consuming, or (in this case) INDESCRIBABLE TORTURE. Strap me to a boulder and let vultures chew out my innards, fine, but do I have to do the mask? In the end, I do apply the mask. It's a few moments of the worst tickle I've ever had the displeasure to endure. Tingling, the description says. Sure, if a million tiny little animals swarming your face is tingling, why not. I literally have to do deep breathing exercises to get through this mask - I have to go to some sort of meditation trance happy place to distance myself from the skin-melting tickle. I've also found squats and lunges to be helpful as a distraction, but sitting still is straight out. (Do be careful not to snort in the mask in a particularly thought-cleansing inhale. You will not enjoy the experience.) And my pores. They're looking better. But at what cost? I'm supposed to be doing the mask right now. Instead, I write this and I wonder... maybe there's a better way to push my boulder. Firmly on the fence. Good luck.

The mask was received in a gelatinous state separated from the side of its container, and could not be applied smoothly on skin. Looked up Youtube reviews of the product and noticed that the mask is supposed to be creamy and much lighter grey in color that applies smoothly on skin, but mine was practically a jiggly dark grey play-dough that could only be applied in big lumpy mess. Except for the fact that the lumps bubbled up slightly, it didn't do anything for my skin and didn't notice any tingling. Either I've received a stale product, a counterfeit item, or a reformulated ineffective product.

This is a super interesting and fun mask! I have oily combination skin that is acne prone. Pros: -Does not burn (it does tingle). -Fun to wear and watch bubble. -A little goes a long way (seriously, don't use a lot; you want a THIN layer on the face. Also, spread it fast! It bubbles almost immediately). -Face felt really moisturized after I rinsed it off. -Short time (the recommended time to leave it on is 5 minutes). Cons: -Messy. Like a few other reviews, I would advise you to use this before you get in the shower. -Tingling sensation is not bad, but I would probably not put this on my chin the next time I used this. It made my want to inch my lips and chin badly. I would probably put a different mask I own on that area. -No immediate results. Very rarely do products have immediate results but I had hoped to notice something. Overall, this is a fun mask, but it's nothing life changing. I will not repurchase this product (although I wouldn't mind trying out other items in this line).

reviews.review_header: Everything you need to know about this mask...
reviews.review_text: Really this is a 10/5 but they wouldn’t let me choose that many stars. Amazing product!! I bought it on a whim because I love skin care products and this was so cute and fun I had to try it, especially for the price. So I got it fairly quickly, only took about a week. When I opened it up that night to try it I was in love!!! The container is a decent size (again, especially for the price), I would say there are like 15 applications in there. It was pretty thick so it easily spread on my face in an even layer, it was also very smooth which I love because I often find hat clay masks are gritty. (The little applicator it comes with deserves a review all on itself. I love this touch!! So much easier to apply and much more sanitary, and the fact that it fits right in the jar is awesome, so nice if I ever take it with me on vacation or something) I gave it about 10 minutes even though the package says 5 because I wanted to see if it would keep bubbling (hint: it does) and STILL my skin was radiant after. So clean and smooth but also so so soft! When I woke up the next morning the acne on my chin had completely stopped swelling and dried up, but not the usual gross scabby dry, like a very nice unnoticeable healed skin. The rest of my complexion was noticeably more even, the redness around my nose and on my cheeks had gone down, and again my skin was so soft! I’m absolutely going to keep using this once a week, replacing my regular clay mask. Note: my skin is in between oily and dry. I get dry patches and I have an oily t-zone. It really just depends on the day. I don’t really get bad acne and I don’t have sensitive skin so I don’t know if the effects would be the same! But I would absolutely advise giving it a try. Also something I had not read about when I looked this mask up was that as soon as you put it on it does get very very itchy as the bubbles begin to form and pop. My boyfriend couldn’t stand the feeling but I didn’t mind it, and found that I got used to it after a minute or so. So if you have a thing with being sensitive to weird feelings you may not like this.

I just used this mask for the second time and really like it. It has the consistency of slime, it's thick and kinda stretchy/sticky. You use the tiny paddle thing it comes with to smear it on your face. It feels a little cold going on and applies pretty easy. It really doesn't take much. I've used it twice and have used maybe 1/4 of it. You leave it on for 5 minutes as it foams up. It tingles and kinda itches, not in a bad way. Then you add water and massage for 2 minutes, this can get a little messy. Then you wash it off. It takes some time to get it all off. I've found it's easier to do it before you take a shower and just wash it off in the shower. It leaves my skin feeling smooth, soft and clean but not too dry. I think it helps reduce the redness a little. Overall, a fun/different face mask that really cleans and softens my skin without over-drying or giving me a rash.

I LOVE it! I got it today and used it about 15 minutes after it was delivered:) it was super fun and my husband even wanted to try it! My face feels so smooth and with my giant pores and excess sebum I was totally impressed. I'll be buying this often!

I'm not too big on face masks, but after seeing all the giggling videos, I had to give it a go. It came with a lovely little stick to apply, which isn't very big, but, one scoop full was enough to cover my whole face. I put it on and INSTANTLY it started to bubble. It feels very interesting, I'm not sure if it's clearing out your pores, but after it bubbled up, I did pat it down and let it dry. It feels very.... Different. There's no way to describe it, but even dry it feels.... slick, like an oil base does, but it's not oily at all. I couldn't take it off at the sink, I needed a shower, and a washcloth. My face does feel very clean, and my skin feels tight. Overall recommend, don't like that you have to almost scrub it off.

I decided to try mask this based on the insanely high customer rating and affordable price just to see if it would live up to the hype. I just finished washing it off my face and I have to say I do see a difference, albeit not a dramatic one. I have enlarged pores in my t-zone and issues with blackheads around my chin and after one use my pores appear smaller and tighter and most of the smallest blackheads and bumps are gone from around my chin. I was impressed, but I think with regular use it might make an even bigger difference - maybe a couple times a week. Oh yeah - it's also really fun to watch and feel the bubbles foaming up on your face! A couple notes: 1. I wore vinyl gloves and used the included spatula to apply the mask to try to avoid contaminating the rest of the product. 2. It was harder to wash off than I expected. The foam forms on the surface of the mask, but underneath it's still thick and creamy. I used a washcloth to help ensure I removed it thoroughly. 3. You'll likely want to use a moisturizer after having washed off the mask as it leaves your skin feeling a little tight.

So much fun! Cloud!!!! I was a cloud face! Ha! Face feels soft and tight afterwards. This is a clay mask so don't forget to moisturize after washing it off. It is slightly difficult to wash off, use a warm face cloth, as recommend on their website, which is in enlgish. It's not clear in the directions that come with he packaging... Because I do not know how to read the directions... They are not in English... Put the mask on, DO NOT USE YOUR FINGERS WHEN TOUCHING THE CONTENTS IN THE CONTAINER. The clay reacts to water, oil and air! So if you'd like to keep the clay in the container from foaming and turning into a moldy cloud, reduce exposure to these elements. The package comes with a little plastic applique. Use that when scooping out the clay from the container and if you'd like to, then use your fingers to spread it around on your face. Let the clay foam up, for about 5-7 min then rub the clay foam around on your face to really loosen up the oil and dirt. Let it rest for about another 5-7 min. It will foam up again, but not as drastically. Then rinse. I'm not a huge mask person, but I have to say it's fun and did leave my face softer and tighter. I looked like a cloud!!!!

*I bought this product without a discount code and my opinions are my own *PACKAGING* I wasn't expecting much for a face mask so cheap, but after trying I have no regrets! The packaging keeps the mask sealed, so it doesn't carbonate inside the container. After unscrewing the lid, there is a removable hard plastic covering which holds a small applicator, but I ended up not using it because I had a better one. *ACTUAL MASK* The mask itself has the slightest scent, almost like a flowery one that you would find in a lotion. I have normal to oily skin, so it didn't affect me, but if you have sensitive skin be careful, and try some on your wrist before putting it on your face. Again, the scent is barely noticeable. It is creamy and thick, but not too difficult to apply. It carbonates after around 30 sec (depending on how much product you use) so I had to hurry while putting it on. It bubbles up for a while, so wait 10-15 minutes before taking it off, again, depending on how much product you use. *REMOVAL* Taking it off was a bit of a hassle because it was so thick. I first tried using my hands and water, but that just slid around the product. I ended up just using a washcloth, which worked fine. *SKIN BENEFITS* The product is supposed to close pores and remove blackheads, which it did moderately. I personally don't have large/noticeable pores, so I can't say much. It did, however, clear away some blackheads. *SUMMARY* All in all, I think this product is great. The fun factor outways the skin benefits, but it is great to do with friends!
Love it! It itches so bad but that's how you know it's working. My face is so soft, I can't stop touching it.

reviews.review_header: I like masks that do not need long exposition
reviews.review_text: Interesting stuff :-) Very often I use it instead my morning face wash. I like masks that do not need long exposition. Use it somewhere one or two times per week because I have another fast peeling mask. It is pleasant, does not have smell, in the jar it looks almost like a jelly (sort of between Popsicle and jelly) of charcoal color (bluish dark grey). I use the amount of less then walnut and bigger then hazel nut - use included spatula. I feel the smooth of my face after using the mask. Not sure about dark nose pores cause I use different things to clean them, but I have the impression that this mask cleans them (may be not significantly - not the WOW, but cleans). I gave 5 for the problem-less of this mask, fast exposition, feelings after using.

It was "fun" to use - but it's really messy and kind of a pain to wash off. I feel like the bubbling is more of a marketing gimmick than the mask showing its effectiveness. After using this about twice a week for a little over a month, I didn't notice any benefits. My face felt really *squeaky* clean immediately after removing the mask, but I had to use a washcloth to help remove the product. This clean feeling was more likely from the exfoliation and intense washing than anything else. It didn't break me out, that's a plus. But that's about it. This would be fun if you have kids, they'd get a kick out of it during a slumber party, etc.

reviews.review_header: This stuff is fun to use
reviews.review_text: This stuff is fun to use! I use this 2-3 times a week because I have extremely oily skin that seems to never get really clean in the pores. This stuff does though. Like most Asian beauty products, it is meant to be used as part of a multi step process. I use this in the evening after the oil cleanse and foam cleanser. I did experiment a little to figure out how much you need to use, and it’s not a lot, but it does need to cover the skin completely. I put it on with a silicone spatula and it starts foaming in just a few seconds. After a minute you look like your face is covered in grey velvet. The instructions say to leave this on for about 5 minutes. To let it work, and it rinses off with warm water. It leaves your skin extremely clean and I’m finding it definitely seems to clean out even deep into the pores. Definitely keeping this as part of my routine.

I just came back from Asia, where masks are all the rage right now. I brought back a ton of sheet masks, but those get expensive quickly, so I opted for this jar mask, after reading all the good reviews. However, I'm always skeptical of over-the-top glowing reviews (with tons of exclamation points,) especially in the field of skincare, where results are subjective and can vary widely depending on the user. So if you're a fellow skeptic, and you're reading this review, I'll cut to the chase and say that it *does* seem to help pores a little, although I can't say it's any more effective than any other clay mask, used regularly. From my perspective, it absorbs some of the waxy oils (sorry, gross) at the entrance to the pore-- the result is that the gunk becomes very easy to extract, if you are so inclined. Could you accomplish the same thing with literally any other clay mask on a weekly basis? Probably. I don't really think the bubbling is legitimately doing much, aside from being entertaining. The mask has a texture like Jell-O pudding, and is easy to use----smear it on your face, and let it sit for 10 minutes. Once it bubbles up, mush it back down and massage it into your skin like a face wash, then rinse the whole thing off. Skin feels clean and normal afterwards, not dry or squeaky. I read some reviews that made it seem like the bubbles were itchy torture, but they're not. It's a bubble mask, not Guantanamo. It's pleasant, it's reasonably effective, and it's more cost-effective than buying individual bubble sheet masks, so I can see myself repurchasing this when the jar is done. However, I also want to mention that I actually prefer the Elizavecca Kangsi Pack 24K Gold Mask, which does the same thing more or less, but seems to temporarily tighten my pores better. You probably can't go wrong with either one--they both temporarily make your pores less noticeable.

reviews.review_header: It's awesome. I use this every few days to keep ...
reviews.review_text: First? It's weird. Second. It's awesome. I use this every few days to keep the dead skin from building up on my face - even with washing, I get a lot of clogged pores and my skin is very dry to begin with. This smooths out my skin texture a bit and takes off a lot of the dead layers. In combination with collagen masks and rosewater spray, this has become a regular part of my skincare routine and my skin is so much happier now. ... Just as a note. You will look like you're molding, and if you have a sunburn for the love of god don't use this stuff on top of it. The acid will eat away a few layers of your skin (gently), but if you're already burnt, it will feel like worse burning. In other news, I'm an idiot. Otherwise great product. Smells really nice, not expensive for what it is and works. If you're expecting some kind of miracle, of course this won't do that, but it's great as upkeep!

So if you're expecting a whole bunch of magical pore action, your not going to get it because let's be real, results take time and this stuff is not that expensive. It is still a great cleanser, leaves the skin soft, and is so much fun to use! Here are a few useful tips: 1. Use the spatula. It keeps you from running the product in the jar because contact with water will make it foam up and disintegrate. No bueno. 2. Spread it in a thin layer. This is very important because the thicker the layer, the harder it is to rinse off and while a thin layer may appear sparse in the beginning, when it foams up, it will expand across the skin. 3. After letting the mask sit for 10-15 minutes, massage the foam into your skin for up to 2 minutes to help stimulate your skin's circulation and get some additional exfoliation action. This also helps to rinse the product off with more ease. 4. Use no more than twice a week. It'll run out quickly if you go over that and a good mask should generate good results with that amount of usage.

This stuff is so much fun! I applied it using the handy-dandy applicator that it came with, but using your fingers would probably work just as well if not better. I had a hard time getting it applied evenly all over my face before it started bubbling. But still... So. Funny. My brother-in-law said I looked like one of the trolls from Frozen, and I must say, the resemblance was uncanny. I left it on for 5-10 minutes, took a multitude of hilarious selfies, then washed it off. If you're in any kind of a hurry, you might hold off on using this stuff until you've got some time to devote to cleanup, because you're gonna need a minute (or 5). After you smoosh down all the bubbles, you'll still have a thick layer of mask to take off, and it doesn't just magically wash away with one splash of water. I'd recommend using a soft washcloth. After I (finally) got it all removed, I was pleasantly surprised by how soft and smooth my skin felt. I've only used it once, so I don't know if it's best for long-term skin care, but I thoroughly enjoyed it and definitely recommend.

reviews.review_header: It’s the most fun facial product I’ve ever used with the bubbling and ...
reviews.review_text: This hardly needs more ratings as it’s already so highly rated. In fact I bought it because it was on a “best-rated Amazon products” list. It’s worth all the raves. It’s the most fun facial product I’ve ever used with the bubbling and I kept scrubbing it off because my skin felt so smooth, I thought the mask wasn’t washed off yet. When I looked in the mirror, I was shocked to see it was completely off. Amazing stuff!

I love Elizavecca's Hell Pore mask and decided to give the Milky Piggy Carbonated Bubble Clay mask a try. I have to say that it was really fun to try. I also loved the reaction of my husband and daughter when they saw it all bubbled up on me. I used the included spatula to apply the mask quickly and left it on for 5 minutes before rinsing off. My skin felt extremely smooth and my pores seemed clearer after using it. I have sensitive skin, and the mask did not irritate my skin at all or cause any breakouts. I put the inner lid back into the container and washed off the spatula after each use and I haven't had an issue with it bubbling in the container. There's a good amount of product in the container, and I'm going to get many applications from it. I would definitely repurchase after I use up the masks that I have.

This mask seriously lives up to all the hype. I loved this mask and was so cool to try with my sister. Its so easy to use all you need to do is use the spatula and apply to your face avoiding mouth and the eyes of course. I recommend working fast because the mask does end up bubbling fast. The sensation of the bubbles are weird but in a good way, to me it kinda itched but not in the kind of reaction type but the bubbles really ticked and was making it hard for me to keep it on for the 5 minutes but i was able to. It feels like the bubbles are kissing your pores is how i explain it. The result was great i have very oily and tons of blackheads that doesn't seem to go away but this mask really did make my skin soft and cleared the blackheads. Even the next day my skin was still really soft. I would recommend this product to anyone wanting to clear their face in a fun way, i mean who doesnt want bubbles on their face right? Such a funny gift as well. I will for sure be purchasing more for gift. I received this product at a discount for my honest and unbias opinion.

reviews.review_header: Great product for adults who still get breakouts.
reviews.review_text: Like a facial, but much less expensive. I use it at least once every few weeks to keep the pores clean and clear. It is relatively easy to use and doesn't skin feeling tight or dry. A little goes a long way and the bottle lasts a long time. Personally I like to lob it on, but some ppl are fine just spreading it thin. Just spread on your face, let it sit like 5-10 min while it bubbles up. Then massage into face for a few minutes before washing it off. If I'm really breaking out I then use a 100% rose toner from 100 percent pure to reduce inflammation and calm breakouts. Then I finish with Mizon snail repair cream to correct any dark spots or acne scars. If I need makeup I go light just using Colorescience mineral sunscreen (doesn't have SPF so it's the best). Been working like a charm for me. I actually got complements on my skin from Korean people using this routine! I have a T-zone oily forehead that sometimes breaks out and a chin/mouth area that often breaks out and seems a tad dry. Rest of my face is normal.

I did not like the sensation of the bubbles at all. It was itchy and uncomfortable and just not enjoyable in the slightest. But that is not the reasoning behind my rating, this mask also did nothing for me. I paid close to $20 when all was said and done, so I guess my expectations were too high. My skin is fairly normal, with some dryness in winter. This didn't improve, but didn't disturb my skin either. I used it twice and passed it on to a friend. I fell for the gimmik and wanted to try it myself, but i would not rebuy or recommend this to anyone.

I had never heard of this product before so took a chance based on reviews. I bought 3 as stocking stuffers for my girls. Imagine the surprise when all of us found 3 of the same product in our stockings. We had bought them for each other. My girls had used this before & were shocked that I had found it among the thousands of masks on Amazon. This mask is the most fun ever especially with a group of girls. Cameras were clicking. A great laugh shared by all & the product actually feels like it’s working. Great feel to the skin after use.

I'll admit we tried this out because of the gimmicky bubbles, but were pleasantly surprised with the effectiveness of the mask. This clay mask works really well and leaves your skin feeling clean and smooth. You have to be carefull when applying it and not go overboard because it does bubble up quite a bit. You can even hear them like Rice Krispies in your ear! Make sure to leave some space around the eyes and nostrils so the bubbles don't get in there. After about 5 minutes you can wash it off, and I would recommend using a small towel to help out because it will take a while if you only use your hands and water. It does a good job and is fun to use.

So this is a very interesting mask. The consistency is very creamy doesn’t really smell like anything application is easy. I did wash my face prior and applied it to a dry face it started to bubble up right away at first it was ok then as a minute or two passed the tickling got worse very uncomfortable I felt like I wanted to scratch my face off. It did settle after about 10 min but still the longest 10 min of my life lol. Does have a little burning nothing too bad. I must warn this is a very stripping mask so don’t apply anything to face after! I usually use a mud mask which I applied to my nose (didn’t apply this product to) and part of my face where the mud mask got burned like h***! Even putting toner burned. My face did feel very soft after bubble mask. Do recommend if you think you can handle don’t recommend if your face is sensitive.

reviews.review_header: Really fun to use and my skin feels smoother
reviews.review_text: This clay mask is very fun to use! It comes with a little spoon in the container that you use to spoon the clay out and then you just apply it to your face (if you're like me you may want to keep it away from your nostrils as it tickles like crazy!) then it just keeps foaming up. It's so fun to watch and makes a fun sound. Then you wash it off, which I've found to be a little difficult. I've started wiping it off with a cloth before actually washing my face with water because it makes it a little easier. It feels like it exfoliates my skin and makes it smoother. Even if I didn't I would still use it as a fun way to pamper myself!

reviews.review_header: ITCHES LIKE HECK AND NEARLY IMPOSSIBLE TO WASH OFF
reviews.review_text: ITCHES LIKE HECK AND NEARLY IMPOSSIBLE TO WASH OFF! I applied this mask using the little plastic spatula that comes with it, and I smeared on a healthy amount. Then I waited for the bubbles, which didn't take long. But if you think it's bubbly at first, wait 10 minutes and it'll REALLY bubble on your face. HOWEVER, as it foams up, it gives the sensation of gentle itches alllll over your face. AND YOU CAN'T SCRATCH IT! Here's where my next issue came: I probably put on too thick of a layer because the top bubbled, but when I went to rinse it off, there was still a lot of unbubbled mask underneath! So I tried rinsing it off and it was really difficult and took a while. Next time, I'll put a thinner layer and see how the bubbling feels, but if it's still agonizingly itchy I probably won't bother again. Maybe that spatula is more helpful for scraping off the excess from your skin rather than applying it.

reviews.review_header: Fun But Slight Impractical Facial Mask
reviews.review_text: The mask although was a little messy, did help clear some of my blackheads. The textures feels a little odd at first when it starts to bubble on the skin, but afterward a it settles down, it becomes quite a messy blob of mess. What is disgruntle about dealing with the product is that when it does dry, it is difficult to get off of the skin unless we wash off before the set directed time. There's really not much products, as the containers seems bigger than what is actually inside. But I do enjoy the mask if settling on a fun and carefree day, though I would like something that does not create much of a mess. When applying make sure the skin is dry to have the product adhere to the skin, as I had the mistake of applying when I was in the shower, and it just plops down onto the shower floor and into the drainage T...T I have other versions of wash off masks and they're more easily to wash off and do not create much of a disaster on towels. If I do repurchase, I would get for a cousin or starter in skincare to let them know that starting isn't all that serious and gritty, there definitely could be a flare of bubbLY fun!

My sister liked how it felt but said it didn't really do anything. I on the other Hand felt like my face was burning off! I don't know what it was but it made my face burn and itch like a really bad sunburn. I covered my face in aloe and by the next day my face was pretty much back to normal but still scary. So if you don't really care if it does anything and don't have sensitive skin what so ever, then this is for you lol. I'm giving it two stars cause it did bubble and was fun until I left like there was hot lava on my face haha.

I will admit I was a little meh with the price when I first saw it. The amount that you use to put on your face this container will quite last awhile! After it starts bubbling? foaming? (I'm not sure the accurate term to use) you can feel it and it does itch a little but not so bad that you can't handle it. My face felt very clean and smooth after using. This would be a great stocking stuffer for preteens, teens, and adults. I wouldn't say this is a unisex product as men may not like the scent but it's not overpowering and the scent seemed to go away after washing it off so maybe it could be?! All in all I'm very happy I purchased this and will be making future purchases!

(for reference i have oily-combination skin with the dryness on my jawline and cheekbones) finnaly got around to buying way after it was super popular. its so fun and my skein feels amazing after. it came right on time which happened to be when i had a friend over. we opened it and immediately used it. its alot of product and i thinks its at a very reasonable price. the little spatula it comes wiht is super useful too. we took endless videos of our ridiculous puffed up bubbly faces and both our skin was gorgeous when we washed it off. i got it at least a few months ago and used it 3 times a month maybe, and there is still enough left for 4-5 masks maybe more or less depending on if you do your whole face or not. its very difficulf to get off with just your hands and water (ift ford an almost gelatime layerunder the bubbles) so i reccomend either doing it before a shower, then showereing it of, or scrubbing it off witht a washcloth. just put mousturizer on after an you will be GLOWING. i will definitely but this product again not just for the hype or because of the fun, but becaus it was a genuinely good mask!

reviews.review_header: The most fun you can have putting on a face mask
reviews.review_text: This is one of the most fun masks I have ever used. I will say that it's smart to rinse the included spatula off between applying the mask to your face and getting more product. I would recommend being prepared to quickly apply this product, as I believe keeping it exposed to the air for too long will cause it to lose some of the carbonation that makes the bubble effect. It's rather difficult to wash off in the sink, so I would recommend using this before you get in the shower. Five starts because it was at full bubbley-ness when my roommate got home and I think I scared him.

reviews.review_header: Super fun to use and leaves skin feeling great!
reviews.review_text: Well at first I was freaking out (my reason for only 4 stars) because when I got the package, some of it had leaked out of the jar and I was afraid the product has ruined. I tried it later that night and it was awesome! It foams up just like all the videos about it, and it leaves my face feeling great and super soft! I definitely advise to make sure you use the applicator that is provided when applying the mask. Using your fingers (easier, I'm sure!) would risk ruining the product by bringing the oils and moisture of your skin into the rest of the product, thus activating the "foaming" effect. Also, wipe your applicator off before placing back on the lid, for this same reason. Keep lid tight to avoid exposure to excess moisture too! I love using this mask! It's so fun and feels great!

reviews.review_header: Yes! A mask that actually works.
reviews.review_text: I really enjoy this product! I was searching high and low for a clay mask that will deep clean my skin, without causing irritation, and this was perfect! Just use a small amount of the mask, spread it on with the little spatula (or use your fingers) and then let it bubble up onto your skin for five minutes. Rub/massage it gently into the face for another two minutes and then rinse off. It is a little hard to rinse off at times but I believe the extra work is worth it. My face feels so clean and soft afterwards! And it smells great too! The carbonation and little bubbles causes my face to tingle and it's such a fun experience (more so than your typical clay mask). I use this product once a week but I believe that it's gentle enough to use 2-3 times per week. As someone who gets the occasional breakout, I'm noticing a difference in my skin! Less breakouts, smaller pores and when I do breakout, it's small and not so large and noticeable. Overall a wonderful product.

reviews.review_header: Great for sensitive and combination skin!
reviews.review_text: I have SUPER sensitive skin, normally with face masks I can only apply to certain areas on my face (T-zone, etc) and/or only leave the masks on for a fraction of the recommended time. Otherwise, my face gets red and irritated and it's not fun. However, when I saw this mask on youtube I thought it looked so much fun, and then I saw how inexpensive it was and I couldn't resist giving it a try! The instructions say to leave it on for five minutes, which I did, after applying to my whole face. I was so pleasantly surprised--none of my usual irritation, my face didn't get red or blotchy at all! I know other people have mentioned that it's itchy, but I didn't think it was that bad. It tingled in the same way bubble bath bubbles or foam soap will tingle--the bubbles popping on your skin are gently tickling you. I found it to be a really nice sensation, and afterward all of my blackheads were gone! I have combination skin, my cheeks get super dry but I have a pretty oily T-zone, and I was really happy that my cheeks didn't feel tight or dried out. Overall, if you have sensitive or combination skin, don't be discouraged from giving this product a try! I had such a blast putting it on and snapchatting my friends. I know it says to use it once a week, but I seriously can't wait to use it again.

I had seen this all over the internet, and I was beginning to take an interest in K-beauty as well, so I went ahead and ordered this mask. Obviously, the carbonation tickles a bit, since there are little bubbles popping up all over your face, but the clay itself is smooth and cooling on your skin. My only issue is that it made my face kind of dry, but that only has to do with my skin type (combination). If you have oily skin, this would probably be the perfect clay mask, but it may be drying if you already have dry skin. I will probably order this again once I run out of product.

reviews.review_header: Feels ridiculous but somehow super amazing at the same time
reviews.review_text: I don’t have time to write reviews very often. I read them a lot, so I’m trying to be better about taking the time out for things I enjoy. This mask is a freaking delight. The bubbles tickle like hell and my skin always feel so fresh and clean afterwards. The countless five star reviews are not wrong. Totally worth the 11 bucks. I’ve done it twice in one week, if that tells you anything. It’s just so much fun and feels like it works really well! Definitely will repurchase when I run out.

reviews.review_header: this product is fun! You guy's it foams
reviews.review_text: Oh yes! this product is fun! You guy's it foams! lol! I ordered this after getting a lil bored with the everyday masks. I wanted something different. This product was on one of my youtube channels in relation to beauty. I'm always up to try new stuff , especially when its so different. Item arrived within the week, packaged nicely. Instructions are not in English but I had seen enough videos to know how to use it. You just cover your face with it avoiding eye area of course and let it do it's thing. You do feel the fizzing and it makes you wanna scratch, but dont! lol, it leaves your face very clean. It's a fun product to use during sleepover parties with the girls or a fun stocking stuffer with xmas coming up. It's very inexpensive and it actually works.

reviews.review_header: The smell is really unpleasant and I had a terrible reaction to this mask
reviews.review_text: The smell is really unpleasant and I had a terrible reaction to this mask. My skin felt like it was burning after I washed it off and for the rest of the night. Not happy but can’t return, gonna toss it.

reviews.review_header: Part of my Sunday beauty ritual
reviews.review_text: This is a part of my Sunday beauty ritual. I am asian with oily/pimple-prone skin and sometimes gets adult acne, that's why I'm a little hesistant to try this or any other korean skincare for that matter. I'm so glad I tried this though (and even researched and started the 10-step Korean skincare) because It really makes my skin soft and smooth, even some little bumps that are threatening to come out as pimples due to clogged pores will suddenly vanish after using this. It is a little messy if you are not careful in applying it, you also have to apply it fast enough to cover your entire face before it starts to bubble up (or carbonate?).

Ok guys, I was looking for a mask for my acne but most of them either make it worse or just make my skin wet haha but this one is great. Leaves my skin feeling moisturized, and dare I say that it’s helped my skin be less oily overall?! I have combo skin(but it’s way more oily than dry) so try this out! Just slow down with it once it clears your skin because I found that using it when my skin is happy makes it’s a little too moist aka a good place for those little pin sized whiteheads to form.

It was a little hard to open. It did was it says and it bubbles up. It's a fun idea. The reality is that it burned my face as soon as I put it on. But my daughter used it too and had no problems with burning. My face is a little more sensitive I guess. It was hard to wash off. It took forever it get off. It did make our skin really soft so that's a plus. My daughter skin was fine. She's 11. My skin however broke out after using this product. So I would not but this again.

I normally don't review stuff but I purchased this after reading all the highly rated reviews - this stuff burned my face, after I took it off I had raw areas of my face that hurt and blotchy areas. I went back and read some reviews and some suggested that this product is expired - that'd explain the cheapness.

This does a great job of cleaning my face! Never used a face mask like this before, so I was very curious. It's really cool how it bubbles up. I typically apply it using the scoop provided making sure to wipe it clean before getting more of the mask(to prevent dirt from my face getting in the product). Then I let it sit and bubble for 5 minutes. I then use my hands to rub the bubbles on my face and let that sit for another minute. Then I wash off. It makes my face feel really clean and smooth. I would only recommend using a few times a week though as I think it is kind of harsh on the face if used daily. Also, since this is an Asian beauty product, everything except the name is in a different language. But it's also a really good price for being an Asian beauty item. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a face mask that is unique but also does a great job at cleaning and softening the face.

reviews.review_header: This is super fun and makes your skin incredibly smooth
reviews.review_text: This is super fun and makes your skin incredibly smooth! Instructions aren't in English, but I youtubed it and what you do is: 1.Use the supplied spatula to put on your face (do not use your fingers, because the oil makes it bubble and you could ruin your whole jar of it) 2. Leave on 5-10 minutes (or longer just to see how big it'll get) 3. (Optional) rub in bubbles and let it sit as a regular mask. 4. Wash off. You should allot a bit of time for this, because it's not the easiest to remove (keeps bubbling, goo-ing, etc) 5. Try not to touch your newly super smooth face

reviews.review_header: Great fun for a slumber party or silly selfies and left our faces soft.
reviews.review_text: I got this for my daughter and I just for fun. It was fun. As a real beauty mask, it's not my first choice. It went on easily and then for me, it tickled like crazy. I didn't know if I'd make it the full time. But my daughter didn't feel the same thing. She just felt cooling. It bubbled up huge and was funny. Then we pushed it into our faces and rinsed. It doesn't come off unless you use a washcloth to rub it off - it's not that it's hard, just too slimy and stuck on your face to make progress with water alone. For me, too much mess and tickling. For my daughter (age 13), she said she'll be using it until it's gone - it did leave our faces super soft.

reviews.review_header: This is a fun product to use
reviews.review_text: This is a fun product to use. Would be great for a spa party. Just like the YouTube videos show, the bubbling can have quite the shock factor. This also feels different from other masks. The bubbles make my skin tingle to the point to where I can't decide if I like it or not. I'd read that you need to apply this to damp skin for the biggest bubble effect and that works great. It's a new addition to my skincare routine. Time will tell if it is actually changing my skin.

reviews.review_header: Everyone needs this in their life.
reviews.review_text: I've never written an actual review for a product but I had to take a moment for this. This is simply amazing. When I first opened it after skimming the instructions I was a little disappointed by the size. Surely this isn't enough to last... but I soldiered on, applying little dabs with the convient paddle. I discovered a little goes a VERY long way. I let it settle for five minutes and it began to bubble! I looked like a little gray pig, oink. Massaged with tepid water then rinsed well and wow! Pores unclogged and skin baby soft. I use products more expensive than this little jar but it achieved and exceed those same results! So impressed. My skin is oily t-zone and super sensitive. Did not overly dry my skin or irritate at all!!

I've heard so many good things about this mask from my friends so I finally decided to give it a try and I'm so happy I did! This is probably the most fun I've had with a face mask EVER, and it's such a good laugh when I put it on with my friends. It leaves my face so soft and bright after every use and the price is so worth it! It does tickle a little and you can actually hear it start fizzing up. The mask "activates" and starts bubbling really quickly after you place it on your face with the little spatula tool that comes with the jar, so try to apply it to your face as fast as you can. This mask is great to do 2-3 times a week because it's not very harsh and good for sensitive skin! It takes some patience to remove and wash off though because it kind of reminds me of a soapy material. Overall, this mask is great for a thorough cleanse. I feel like I just went to the spa and got a facial after this every time!

reviews.review_header: This is so fun to use
reviews.review_text: This is so fun to use! I even got my husband to try this even though he never lets me do anything to his face. The bubbling and foaming action really gives you the feeling that your pores are being cleaned. Beware, do not put it under your nose because it will tickle and itch and it will take away from the experience. I recommend spreading this on your face quickly, because the bubbling is instant. I also read that you can press down the bubbles and further massage your face (which also felt very good) for a deeper cleaning. Rinsing took a little longer than I expected because the product builds a lather. But the end result is so worth it. My face felt so clean and fresh and smooth! I felt like my face could breathe! This is definitely an alternative to those harsher facial scrubs. FYI - you get slight redness after you wash this off, but it doesn't last too long.

I'm not sure if the product helps my skin at all but all I know is that I LOVE how it feels when it's on my face. The tiny bubbles gives you a tingle like massage all over your face. I convinced my husband to try it and one day and he also loved the way it felt (I walked in the room to find that he had used it without me!). You have to use the little scoop included inside the lid to keep the clay in the jar free of oils. I'd definitely recommend.

This is a fun mask! After seeing various YouTubers try out this product, I decided that I had to try it for myself. And I was not disappointed. I’ve only recently gotten into using face masks this year, so my experience is kind of limited, but I have to say that I really, really like this mask. It’s so unique! The bubbles tickle a lot, so do be sure to avoid getting it too close to your nose and eyes. I made the mistake of getting it too close to my nose and had to deal with the constant ‘I gotta sneeze!’ feeling until I rinsed it off. My face felt very smooth and soft and clean afterwards, with no allergic reactions (my skin isn’t sensitive, though) and no drying or flaking.

reviews.review_header: This mask is wonderful! Yes I broke out the first couple weeks
reviews.review_text: This mask is wonderful! Yes I broke out the first couple weeks, but stick with it! Just like any new product your skin has to adjust, if you want instant results go see a cosmetic surgeon or get botox. I use this every night after I wash my face, then I use toner, a retinol serum followed by vitamin e cream and my face looks glowing and some how plump in the morning! It's super fun to use too! Gets all bubbly! It requires a little work to get off, but once you realize that and get used to it, it's nothing at all. I was just used to the ease of white clay masks. It smells nice too and comes with a little spatula for getting the product out! Great packaging!

reviews.review_header: Love! I feel so much cleaner!
reviews.review_text: I LOVE this mask. I decided to write a review right now right after using it for the 3rd time. I can feel the difference! I feel my face clean and refreshed. I don't use it too often but I had been having whiteheads as if I don't wash my face well with just my cleanser (and I use a spin brush) so I decided to use this and I feel so good! It gets a bIt itchy after like 5 minutes of having it on, but you just need to resist the urge. I truly recommend it! The only negative I would have to say is that it takes forever to wash off. And not sure if it's a good or bad thing, but it feels like you still have some on even after washing it off with water. It feels a little too smooth. When it dries, you can feel your face tightening. Overall extremely happy!

reviews.review_header: Great, be patient washing it off!
reviews.review_text: Very nice exfoliating sensation. It tickles quite a bit when the bubbles activate. How I use it: - put some on the plastic applicator & reseal the container. -spread with applicator and spread gently with fingers. It will go on like a thick jelly paste. - allow to bubble. It may dry out and peel. However, if it peels don’t get it wet! It will take forever to clean up. - be patient washing it! It will take a while to wash off. It is very slippery and lathers extensively. Results: -Very smooth skin! -Can’t tell if it cleaned out my pores, but my skin looked smoother as it removed oils.

So I've only used this once, but I am just loving it. After foaming and bubbling in my face for about three minutes, my skin feels baby soft. My only complaint: the fizziness actually tickles! It became a challenge to keep it on my face--ordinarily I'd leave it on the full five minutes, but I just couldn't take it. But the effects are undeniable, and my sensitive skin doesn't feel the least bit irritated. I think this will be a fun thing to do with kids, too. I may have a contest to see who can keep it on her face the longest... The fragrance is very light and inoffensive--important for a product applied to the face.

reviews.review_header: Love Love Love! Skin Feels Great!
reviews.review_text: I love this stuff! I received some for a gift, and then purchased it for my daughter from Amazon. It feels like a clay mask going on, and then starts bubbling and turns to a thinner substance when it's done. I feel like it is very gentle on my face. My skin feels amazing after I wash it off. It feels like I used moisturizer, even though I did not. I hear that these masks are very popular in Japan.

Does this stuff actually help my skin? Hard to say... mostly because everything on the packaging is in another language. I don't really notice any crazy cool results after I use it but I'm still giving this a whopping 5 stars because of how funny you look when you put it on. You turn in to a little swamp monster and applying it with the little spoon is actually kind of fun too. WARNING THOUGH it can get a little uncomfortable when it starts to bubble up and expand, but just look in the mirror and start laughing at yourself and you'll forget about that part. P.S. make sure you don't leave the lid off of it too long. The air is what activates it.

This is fun. You put on a thin layer, and 5 minutes later, you look like a monster in the woods. It bubbles up from the moment it goes on, and it just keeps growing. I find that the paddle isn't useful. It's too small to be useful. But I scoop out the mask with my fingers and spread it on and then wait. I love the little tickle of the bubbles and I always laugh to look at my face in the mirror before rinsing. I wish the instructions were repeated in english somewhere, but it's not like it's that hard to know how to use it. I like how my skin feels after using this mask. I like that there's no sting, no pulling or tugging, and no stink. I will definitely be buying more of this in the future... oh wait, I already have. :)

reviews.review_header: Makes my nose tickle in a good way!
reviews.review_text: Love this stuff! I use it as a special treat for my face after a rough skin week (Lots of sun or wind or makeup or sweat or hormones or all of the above.. So basically every week). It leaves my skin feeling soft and happy and soothed, almost like a blank slate to start the new week off on. If you haven't used it, make sure to only leave it on for a couple of minutes (I know.. It says mask. I hear or read mask I think I can leave it on for a while.. You can't with this. At least I couldn't. Made my face raw the first time I used it because I left it on waay to long.) It foams up a lot so you only need a thin layer and it tickles the heck out of your nose. My one gripe is that the smell is a little strong for me. I really wish it was subtler, and even though it goes away as soon as you rinse, it knocks it down a star for me. Also bigger size containers for addicts like me would be awesome!

reviews.review_header: great alternative to a dry hard on your face clay mask
reviews.review_text: So I saw the rating, have large pores and have always had to deal with black heads all my life and figured why not. The "clay" is actually more of a gooey texture. Make sure to have something handy to pry open the plastic seal cover that holds the scoop. Scoop a quarter size amount and use the spatula to spread it quickly on your clean face, concentrating on your t zone or trouble spots. The clay will start to bubble and foam on your face. Be careful to not put any close to your nostril, you WILL get some bubbles go IN your nares. It has a slight weird smell to it that I can deal with but can see may not be tolerated too well by others. My last picture shows the clay drying up, I find that if I leave it on too long past this point, it is harder for me to wash the clay off my face. I end up with chunks of clay I have to rub off my face. You will be able to feel the softness of your skin as you wash the mask off and my pores and blackheads are noticably less visible as well. I like this better than your typical clay masks since it takes less work to wash off all the clay. Keep in mind that your skin will feel super dry after this so follow up with your toner, serum and moisturizers!! I've added this to my regimen every other day to keep those black heads at bay...

reviews.review_header: Won't do miracles, but fun and helps a bit
reviews.review_text: My boyfriend and I decided to try this and it really is fun to use. We were both laughing at each other as it bubbled up. After we washed it off, we did notice an immediate difference - my pores looked a little smaller, and my boyfriend swears it brought some of his pimples to a head. I don't think it worked miracles or anything, but I've never seen a difference with any other mask, so even a minor one is pretty amazing. Plus, super fun to use!

Omg this is fun. It works really fast and doesn't take much. Pro tip: scoop what you need and paint on with brush and use electric face scrubber to get off in shower if possible. It will probably travel up your nose a little. Get ready for a bit of mess. It doesn't come off super easy but the mask does a great job of getting off the grease without over drying.

I bought this product before sleeping over my friend's house because we wanted to see the results together. The mask comes with an applicator, which is useful because using your hands would contaminate the mask and may cause it to bubble up inside the container. The mask smells really good. It felt cool and minty on our skin. This is my first time trying a product from Elizavecca and it certainly won't be my last. We waited 5 mins for the mask to bubble up. We were laughing the whole time because it felt ticklish and we could actually hear it bubbling up. Then we spent 2 mins rubbing our faces to spread the mask. We took about 10-15 mins rinsing it off because it could stick to your skin. However, it was all worth it. Our faces became smoother and the smell is still there. I apply it about once a week because some reviews said it can make your skin really dry. It made my friend's skin dry, but not mine. After 3 weeks, I noticed that my blackheads decreased. I hope it would only take one more use for all of my blackheads to disappear.

This is such a funny, interesting experience. This goes on just as other clay masks. It starts to dry pretty quickly and then the foaming starts. It foams and foams. I suggest using the spatula or something else (spoon for example) to get the mask out of the tub. I found putting my fingers into the tub made the product in the tub fizz up too. You need very little of this because a little bit goes a long way. This means that although the spatula is kind of awkward to use, it works fine. After using it my face felt tighter and cleaner and much more smooth. I will certainly use it again.

reviews.review_header: Stop what you're doing, get this product. No really, stop.
reviews.review_text: LOVE this stuff!!! Tried a one time use mask like this from Walmart and fell in love with it. The foam. The foam changes lives people. I have stubborn bumps and imperfections and this is the only thing that helps. Like stop what you are doing, and BUY IT. This s*** changes the games don't feel like I'm hurting my face with a peel off or drying it out with a regular mask. Just so satisfied. It's itchy as hell though. I put it on right before my shower. Rinse off with as coldnof water as you can take

reviews.review_header: Which I love, then you don't have to worry about contaminating ...
reviews.review_text: It came packaged very well, with a spatula attached to the inside cover to help get the product out. Which I love, then you don't have to worry about contaminating the product with any dirt or debris from your hands. I would recommend only applying a thin layer at first until you get the hang of it. I made the mistake of putting some more on when it didn't start to bubble up for awhile, and then when it started to, it was huge on my face. Once it starts to bubble on your skin, it gives a nice tingling sensation. For me personally, I didn't keep it on too long as it started to make my face itch. Once I rinsed it off though, my skin looked so nice. My skin was soft and my pores weren't as big. I'm not sure if I would order again, because I didn't like how it made my face itch. But I'd say its worth trying!

reviews.review_header: This mask is one that you stoically endure while valiantly resisting the overwhelming urge to scratch your nose.
reviews.review_text: This is a good mask but NOT a relaxing one. The smell is nice, but I can barely stand the mask for fifteen minutes because the bubbles make my face itch like crazy (luckily this seems to be due entirely to the bubbling and not anything to do with ingredient allergies or skin reactions). Definitely try not to sneeze while its on. The foam will spray everywhere. I also had to learn not to get the product too close to my eyes and nostrils. Once it starts foaming, the mask expands (duh); if it's too close to eyes and nostrils... Well, just don't make the same mistake I did and end up wiping it out of your eyelashes or nearly inhaling foam. Overall, I probably won't buy this again because, while its an interesting novelty product and does seem to work reasonably well, it's not what I'm looking for in a mask. This is not the type of mask that you can put on and wear for long periods, ignoring it as you soak in the tub or watch TV or work on the computer. This mask is one that you stoically endure while valiantly resisting the overwhelming urge to scratch your nose.

When you first put this mask you have to be quick! I used the spatula it came with but since it's so small i can only get a bit at a time. Don't leave the jar open for too or the product inside will start reacting. Once the mask is on it tingles and you can feel the bubbles popping on your face. Such a weird sensation but also really cool 😅. After the time spent on your face rub the product in then wash it. It will feel like you put your face through an intense wash. Pat dry your face then tone and immediately put on moisturizer to put back that moisture in your skin since this product can be very drying. The scent is strong but doesn't smell bad. Overall, it's a fun mask you can do with your friends and take a lot of funny snapchat videos 😂.

I wanted to use this a few times before I left a review, so here goes! 3rd use was today. My blackheads are no longer a problem, my skin is softer, and this mask is just fun to use. A+ product. People have left instructions on how to use it.. follow them. Cleanse your face before use, portion out what you'll use then close the container so it doesn't all carbonate. Use the little plastic thingy to put a thin layer on your face. Leave on for as long as you can handle the bubbles. I usually last 5 minutes. I also use the plastic thingy to remove the mask. I love it.

reviews.review_header: Hubby and I enjoy this product so much
reviews.review_text: Hubby and I enjoy this product so much! Before the instructions was written in Korean now it's updated with English directions at the back of the box. Enjoy!

Disappointed by the product I received. There was no seal or spatula when I opened the container and the mask had already activated and bubbled, so when I applied it there was no bubbling at all. It was just a clay mask. I bought this mask though for the bubbling effect. I can pay less and get more product with a different clay mask.

I agree with a lot of the people, this product rocks. When you first put it on, put a few small blobs on your face. Forehead, nose, and cheeks, then use fingertips to spread them all over your face, should take 10-20 seconds. No need to wash your face prior to applying this. Then let it sit and the bubbles start to form. Your face may feel ticklish because the bubbles are forming and popping. After 5 mins or so, wet your fingers and rub your face in circular motions to re hydrate and work in the clay mask again. Then wash it off and you're done. The clay does take a little more time to wash off completely than a typical cleanser. The results I received made my skin look brighter and my pores smaller. I use this about once a week.

reviews.review_header: Milky Piggy Carbonated bubble clay will tickle your senses
reviews.review_text: This stuff is so much fun. It works great, if you can handle the bubbles tickling your face! The hardest part is leaving it on long enough for it to work. It just looks like gray clay mask. It comes with a little spatula to apply it to your face. I really recommend that you use the spatula, or you will be scrubbing clay out of your nails for days. I love the packaging, it's adorable. I just wish there was a sticker with english instructions. everything was in korean, so we just kind of guessed.

I saw a pop up ad for this on Facebook and decided to give it a try.. it's great! It does bubble the way it claims to and after one use I did notice that my skin was softer and felt very clean.. I didn't have a breakout of any kind so not sure how well it works on that but wanted to know so I got my 13 year old to try it.. he breaks out on his nose and chin so that's where I put it on him and after a couple of uses his skin showed definite improvement and he had fun trying it...lol.. I would recommend this !

reviews.review_header: A fantastic mask for those who can grit their teeth through the tickles
reviews.review_text: I love how it pulls oil and unclogs my pores without drying out my skin. I use this at the end of my workweek and feeling the makeup and dirt disappear from my pores. I was impressed with how much it foams when open to air. Because of this, I would tell users to close the jar immediately after opening to prevent the product from bubbling up in the container. But be warned: the tickling sensation is a lot more uncomfortable than I thought it would be. I'm particularly ticklish, so use it at your own discretion. The sensation disappears after you rub the product in as directed. Do know that after you rub it in, the product will bubble up again if exposed to air for a period of time. It's different from other masks, and I definitely recommend it for people who want to try something different and refreshing in their skin care routine!

This was fun. My high school / college aged kids, cousin, husband and I all did this together for the first time while on vacation. It really bubbles up and gets kind of puffy, so that's funny to see what everybody looks like. When I rinsed it off, my face felt wonderful. Very soft and clean. A couple of the other people doing it didn't really like it because I think they didn't like the feel of it bubbling on their face. I thought it was kind of neat and didn't bother me at all. I took one star off because of the people who didn't really care for it and because it doesn't come with instructions in English. You can find instructions (and lots of videos) online of how to use it.

reviews.review_header: its fun, and it doesn't leave skin over dry or ...
reviews.review_text: This stuff is hilarious. It works really well, its fun, and it doesn't leave skin over dry or stretched tight. It removes dirt and oil, and leaves skin soft. Its also really fun. This would be a great product for a girls night, or a spa night. Its just fun, and it works. It has a smell like the clay that is in it, which is a little heavy, but rinse off, and isn't artificial, its just what the clay smells like. I will totally buy more when this jar runs out.

When I first got this product, it exceeded my expectations. Left it on for 5 minutes, rubbed it in and let it sit for an additional minute and most of my blackheads around my nose were gone. However, the mask has become less and less effective with time. I was quite anal about only using the spatula to dispense product as to not get any oils into the container, and keeping it sealed tightly. I understand that products like this will eventually expire, but this did so in only two months.

I live masks and this one is very different and entertaining. Leaves skin extremely clean and just blank canvas feeling. I'm not in love with how it feels when wearing I can barely stand it actually because it is like 1000 like tickles in no way painful just tickles like crazy. I almost never take stars of from packaging and things of that manner because I really only care about the goods and if they work but this container annoys me a little. It includes a spatula which in nice but is hard to smooth around nose with small flat stiff spatial which is mine and the majority of peoples biggest problem area. A bendable spatula or just your finger would work better. And the second air lid gets stuck a lot, and is always a mess lol.

reviews.review_header: Tickley, bubbley fun that softens and moisturizes
reviews.review_text: First impressions: I received this product today. I was so excited to use it. Unfortunately no English directions are listed, so I came on Amazon. I still had questions, so I went on YouTube. So I started with a dry, clean face and only took out a small amount of product that I was using so I wouldn't expose the rest to air. I actually liked the included spatula, and I think it worked well. It was a unique feeling. After it went on, it did start to bubble quickly, so application should be on the faster side. It tickle/itches almost unbearably, but the sensation only lasts a few minutes. The second bubbling sensation is quite nice, and I really could have sat around all day with it on my face... If my face wasn't purple and I didn't have to go to work today. I had it on about 10 minutes. I did rub it in at the end with my fingers. I'm not sure this did anything but make the removal process a tad easier. It took a long time to rinse off. And it tastes horrible, so heed my warning and avoid your lips during the rinse process. After drying my face I had two thoughts. 1. Hey, good, my skin did not get dyed purple. This kind of was a fleeting worry I had throughout the experience. 2. My skin is so soft. I didn't even need to follow up with moisturizer, which is unheard of in my world. So now it's roughly 20 minutes past mask usage. Skin still feels great, but I'm thinking of putting on some moisturizer at this point. Bottom line: Can't wait to use it again! I'm also going to put it on hubby to giggle as he tickles uncontrollably!!

I’ve seen this product blasted over buzzfeed and other articles about “what our readers are crazy about” etc. I don’t typically have problematic skin so I wasn’t worried about it irratating or anything (which it didn’t). And it definitely did bubble up as promised, there was just much to be desired. There was no cool tingling feeling some clay masks give. My skin didn’t feel moist or softer after, honestly it felt dried out. With that said the bubbles were cool to look at the first time I used it, but after that they just made me want to itch my face If you’re just looking for the bubbles you can’t go wrong. Although, do make sure your face is completely damp or they won’t bubble (packaging not in English) But if you’re looking for something that is actually good for your skin I would move on

Super fun and made my skin feel extra soft. I love the feeling of the mask it also smells like mint. It bubbles up and then you rub it into your skin. My skin felt clean and smooth. Pores felt smaller though it just may be me. I use this once a week and love it. Makes for a nice trick on you SO if they have never seen it before as the bubbles get pretty big. Down sides is if its too close to your eye sockets it can interfere with you eyesight, but that's it. Totally worth the price, its more expensive on Memebox or other websites I have found. It arrived quickly and without any damage or hassle.

The most fun I've ever had with a mask. It bubbles and feels great. I don't know if I'd want too many people to see me with this on - some areas bubble way more than others so your face looks very comical. The last time I did the mask I took selfies and sent to my granddaughter (she's 21) and cracked her up. It washes off with a warm wash cloth and my face does feel great after.

reviews.review_header: It's a great product to have while doing slumber parties or something ...
reviews.review_text: It's a great product to have while doing slumber parties or something with friends. It bubbles up and tickles and its just fun to look at and experience. I did notice that it did get most of the blackheads out and my skin was smoother, but the biggest 'argh' of it..was that its a pain to scrub off.. since its a clay mask, it takes forever and I'm not a fan of clogging my sink with clay... I'm sure doing it a few times wouldn't hurt but I felt like this product went on thick and it could create future problems if used often lol

Most likely, you're looking into this mask because of the viral videos in which it is featured. If you're looking for a fun night in, a laugh, and a unique mask, then this is totally worth the fair price! The results are hilarious, just like they are in the videos. I don't think it does much for your skin, but it is highly amusing and it would do great for a beauty night solo or with your friends.

I have used this mask twice and so far I love it. I have acne scars and enlarged pores and blackheads and after 2 uses I can already notice a difference in the appearance of my skin. My pores look smaller already and the blackheads are clearing already. I have used everything on my face including proactiv and nothing works on my pores. I LOVE this mask it looks so funny and the only downside is that it's very itchy as it's bubbling but otherwise I recommend to anyone looking for results!

Ingredients listed on this listing is Ingredients green tea extract, aloe vera leaf extract, matcha powder, charcoal powder, pomegranate extract, fermented soy extract, alantoin, peony root extract, oregano leaf extract, white willow peel extract, portulaca extract, cinnamon extract BUT what I received was not this product. I believe I received their older version which I purposefully chose not to purchase. The expiration date on the box for this item did not match the expiration date on the item itself.

I can see this being a cool product if you don't have any sort of sensitive skin, but I really hated it. It felt like my face was on fire and covered in fire ants. Itching+burning is a bad mix.
